medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation and management of Barrett’s esophagus with high-grade dysplasia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Seven months prior to the current evaluation, the patient experienced rectal bleeding. She had occasional heartburn but no dysphagia, anorexia, abdominal pain, or weight loss. Colonoscopy revealed a resected cecal polyp which was a tubulovillous adenoma. Four months after initial diagnosis, follow-up endoscopy showed persistent Barrett’s esophagus with high-grade dysplasia. Five weeks later, esophageal ultrasonography revealed a 5-cm-long segment with signs consistent with Barrett’s esophagus and a 1-cm polypoid lesion.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Morbid obesity, inflammatory polyarthritis treated with prednisone and methotrexate, hypertension, and type 2 diabetes.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had a 20-pack-year smoking history but quit six years ago. She lives with her husband and has four children.
